meanings.sent1: The small act of kindness was a redeeming quality in an otherwise difficult day.
meanings.sent2: Her smile was the redeeming feature of the gloomy room.
meanings.sent3: His terrible jokes were somehow redeeming, making everyone laugh despite their cheesiness.
meanings.sent4: The lone flower in the barren field was a redeeming symbol of hope.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected apology was a redeeming gesture that repaired their friendship.

meanings.sent1: She tried to redeem her mistake by offering to help with the project.
meanings.sent2: He wanted to redeem himself after letting his team down in the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to redeem knocking over the vase by bringing a toy as a peace offering.
meanings.sent4: The student worked hard to redeem his low grades with a stellar final exam.
meanings.sent5: The chef tried to redeem the burnt dish by adding extra seasoning to improve the flavor.

meanings.sent1: The hero's sacrifice was enough to redeem the villain from his evil ways.
meanings.sent2: She believed that love could redeem even the most sinful of hearts.
meanings.sent3: The magical potion was said to redeem anyone who drank it from their past wrongdoings.
meanings.sent4: The wise elder's words had the power to redeem those who sought forgiveness.
meanings.sent5: The ancient prophecy foretold a chosen one who would redeem the kingdom from darkness.

meanings.definition: Serving to offset or compensate for faults or deficiencies
meanings.sent1: The redeeming quality of the old house was its beautiful garden.
meanings.sent2: His redeeming trait was his unwavering loyalty to his friends.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain was a redeeming factor in the scorching heat of the day.
meanings.sent4: The laughter of children was a redeeming sound in the midst of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The artist's unique style was a redeeming feature that set her apart from others.
